alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 7:55AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN WEBER...SOUTHEASTERN CACHE...SOUTHERN RICH...EASTERN MORGAN...NORTHERN SUMMIT AND UINTA COUNTIES... At 755 AM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from 19 miles west of Woodruff to East Canyon State Park...and moving east at 50 mph. Locations impacted include... Evanston, Coalville, Lyman, Woodruff, Lonetree, East Canyon State Park, Robertson, Mountain View, North Snyderville Basin, Henefer, Hoytsville, Millburne, Fort Bridger, Carter, Echo Reservoir, Ragen, Emory, Castle Rock, Echo and Almy. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 55. Interstate 84 between mile markers 110 and 119. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 153 and 196. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 47 and 54. * strong winds in excess of 45 mph are possible with this squall. * sudden and brief snowfall rates greater than 2 inches per hour are possible in this squall. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Western Uinta Mountains
